main event: Three airmen at Stewart Air Force Base in New York observed a round, multi-colored object in the sky on October 21, 1966.
interesting points: The object had alternately flashing red, green, and white colors.
The object appeared to be moving slowly back and forth over the base pond.
The object did not disappear while under observation for 20-30 minutes.
On a later evening, the investigating officer identified the same object as the star Sirius.
Another similar report was made the same night from Spring Valley, New York, with the same findings.
location: Stewart Air Force Base, New York
